resources.string: In the heart of santorini is this superb property "splendour resort" very very convenient location ,close to market ,superb view and very friendly staff.just a walk to the happening Fira market and bikes and car on rent just a hop away. Splendid splendour
Located 2 km from Fira, Nautilus Dome Suites is built on the side of the caldera and features a pool surrounded by a wooden deck with sun loungers and umbrellas.
Situated just a few minutes walk away from Fira’s central square, Hotel Hellas offers accommodation with views to the Aegean Sea and free WiFi in public areas.
Its culinary history has been established and recognised for over 90 years. Three generations of Lefteris Roussos family have all shared the same love and passion for Santorini
Delicious food. Great staff. Awesome prices. Must visit. Tapas style. Have to wait a bit for a table as they dont take reservations But thats okIts a great people watching street Really nice staff
Volcano Blue had the BEST views of Fira and the food was delicious. We were able to make a reservation and were seated immediately after we arrived. The staff was super friendly and accommodating.
This cozy shop has everything you need to take with you , like excellent joyels and art objects. Do not miss to visit ! Very good prices !!

Baseggio Santorini Maison Shopping Center is a small tourist shopping center in Fira, Greece. It offers many items of jewelry and clothing. You could visit this place if you’re in the city to collect a few trinkets and souvenirs for yourself and your friends and family
Marmarini shop in Oia on the central footpath on the caldera. Youll fin artworks, ceramics and paintings by Greek artists. Also nice, small items for presents and momentoes of Santorini.
The Archaeological Museum of Thera is a museum in Fira, Santorini, Greece. It was built in 1960 to replace an older one which had collapsed by the 1956 Amorgos earthquake.
It is by far one of the most amazing old houses. Built in 1888 by Argyros. A fine merchant of wine and a winemaker
Familiarize yourself with the way people lived at Santorini in the past! Exhibitions of this museum are really interesting.
